page.title: 03St. Agnes:People's attitudes
page.content: St. Agnes is a very rural community, and at the same time a very caring one. Various fund-raising schemes are organised to help local charities such as Cancer Research, R.N.L.I., etc. The peace and quiet of days gone by is preferred by those with memories of the village life then as opposed to the tourist industry of today, which is not too popular with this section of the community. The surrounding areas are virtually unspoilt, and many locals wish it to remain so. Older residents have no ambition to travel. Many of them have not been outside Cornwall; this has produced a very close-knit community, with rather narrow, fixed attitudes. Methodism - introduced by John and Charles Wesley on their visits to St. Agnes - continues, and is now becoming a strong and influential tradition.
